Package org.eso.ias.plugin.filter

Interface Filter

All Known Implementing Classes:
AverageBySamples, AverageByTime, FilterBase, NoneFilter
public interface Filter
The interface defining filter to apply to a monitored value before sending to the IAS core.
Author:
acaproni

  • Method Details

    • newSample

      Optional<FilteredValue> newSample(Filter.EnrichedSample newSample) throws FilterException
      Acquire a new sample and recalculate the value applying the filtering.

      The new filter is added to the history then the filter is applied by calling apply() and the value returned to the caller.

      The sample offered must be newer then the newer sample in the list i.e. the filter expects that the samples arrive ordered as they are produced i.e. timely ordered.

      Parameters:
      newSample - The not-null sample to submit to the filter
      Returns:
      the value after applying the filter the newly received filter
      Throws:
      FilterException - If the sample is not timely ordered

    • apply

      Optional<FilteredValue> apply()
      Apply the filter to the samples already in the history and return the filtered value.

      This method is meant to be called when the refresh rate of the monitored point elapses without adding new samples.

      Returns:
      The value after applying the filter or empty if no samples has been received
